comments:
Open repositories view. Add new *Bugzilla* repository. Use url https://bugzilla.redhat.com/bugzilla/ and login/password from there.
Validate connection to see that credentials are ok.

Hit finish, see that Eclipse freeze and wait few minutes. UI unfreeze but wizard is not closed.
the following error about failed connection to *Jira* repository is in the log:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 0 2006-03-17 00:31:00.023

Forgot to mention another weird thing.

After canceling wizard, repository https://bugzilla.redhat.com/bugzilla/ does not appear in repositories view but I can see it in new bugzilla query wizard.

I've tried poking at it multiple ways but can not reproduce this.  It almost seems like your original selection was not registered.  We are planning on releaseing 0.4.10 today, and a new dev build will be available in about 10 minutes.  If you could try to reproduce again with that I would appreciate it.

(In reply to comment #2)
> I've tried poking at it multiple ways but can not reproduce this.  It almost
> seems like your original selection was not registered.  We are planning on
> releaseing 0.4.10 today, and a new dev build will be available in about 10
> minutes.  If you could try to reproduce again with that I would appreciate it.

This is funny and weird. 

What actually happening is that on any action in repository view (add or delete) it is trying to connect to every registered server (frobably from saveRepositories() if you look at the stack trace) and that is happening in the UI thread. One of my Jira servers is sitting behind VPN, which I not always have up, so I've got that UI freeze while connection timed out.

Also, it would help if that connection error will have an url that is failing...

Well, it wasn't funny, but it was weird ;)

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 134870 ***

traces.message: Unable to connect to server.  Please check the URL.
